page.title: 07Williots Manor
page.content: Williots Manor is probably the oldest house in Potters Bar. It is about 200 years old. It faces the beefeater.(The Beefeater is just past the railway bridge). The house was quite big and has now turned into a pub.The house has leaded windows. Most of it is original. The roof has slates instead of tiles you could probably have climbed the chimney. A lord would have a wife and some children he would also have lots of servants to do every thing for him. The lord owned all the land round the Manor. Glass was not very common so only the lords and rich people would have glass. It was hard to make in large sheets so small sheets where made and held together with lead.
